metadata.Title: CVE-2020-0444 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
In audit_free_lsm_field of auditfilter.c, there is a possible bad kfree dueto a logic error in audit_data_to_entry. This could lead to localescalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed.User interaction is not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions:Android kernelAndroid ID: A-150693166References: Upstream kernel

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-0444` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-99-generic - 4.15.0-99.100
linux-image-4.15.0-99-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-99.100
linux-image-4.15.0-99-lowlatency - 4.15.0-99.100
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-99-generic - 4.15.0-99.100

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-99.100').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1').
